intro: Emarhendia bettiana, commonly known as the white sand lily, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in sandy or loamy soils. The plant produces small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it prefers full sun to partial shade. Emarhendia bettiana is adapted to well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland areas.
